repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Lee Pavao papers
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. Lee Pavao was an advertising executive who served in a number of JWT offices before becoming President and CEO of JWT Brazil. The Lee Pavao papers include advertisements and advertising designs, clippings, correspondence, meeting minutes and planning documents, photographs, presentations, reports, slides, speeches and other materials relating to Pavao's career, primarily in Latin American offices in Brazil and Peru. Client companies represented include Ford, Kellogg and Kodak. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Administrative Files; Presentations and Speeches; Photographs and Slides.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. Lee Pavao was an advertising executive who served in a number of JWT offices before becoming President and CEO of JWT Brazil.

Lee Pavao was born in 1934 in Massachusetts. He attended the University of Massachusetts at Dartmouth (BS, Advertising Design, 1956) and joined JWT in New York, but was soon after drafted into the U.S. Army (1956-1958). Pavao returned to JWT New York (1958-1963) before being reassigned to a number of JWT's European offices (Amsterdam 1963-1965, Madrid 1967-1969) before returning to New York. Pavao spent the rest of his career in various JWT offices in Latin America (primarily Sao Paulo and Lima) before being named President and CEO of JWT Brazil in 1980, eventually assuming responsibility for JWT operations across Latin America. Pavao retired to Chapel Hill, North Carolina in 1988 where he became a community activist and member of City Council. He died in 2019.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Lee Pavao papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Lee Pavao papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0111

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Lee Pavao papers include advertisements and advertising designs, clippings, correspondence, meeting minutes and planning documents, photographs, presentations, reports, slides, speeches and other materials relating to Pavao's career, primarily in Latin American offices in Brazil and Peru. Client companies represented include Ford, Kellogg and Kodak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Alcan; Alianza para el Progreso (Spanish); Chesterfield and Winfield cigarettes (Dutch); Firestone (Spanish); First National City Bank (Citibank) Traveler's Checks; Planters Peanuts; Shield deodorant; Swift detergent (Dutch); Seven-Up (Dutch)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: JWT Buenos Aires 1987 (Spanish); JWT Madrid 1960s (Spanish); Reader's Digest Overseas Military Edition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Text of shirt: I found myself rumaging through the JWT Archives at Duke University and ended up having drinks and supper at Lee Pavao's, an old owl's roost, in "The Southern Part of Heaven" Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA! September 29, 1992

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Speeches: Jeremy Bullmore (What We Have Learned about Creating Advertising); Judie Lannon (JWT Worldwide Staff Survey); Marlene Hore (The Creative Marketplace in Target Groups); Allen Thomas (Multinational Advertising)

did.unittitle: Presentation to Board of Directors--Competitive Analysis
Board of Directors Meeting--JWT Brazil 50th anniversary
Latin American Managers Meeting--Promotional merchandise items
Lee Pavao at Jeca Tatu Awards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Award created by the agency Castelo Branco e Associades (CBBA) for excellence in marketing and communications in Brazil, named for Jeca Tatuzinho, a character created by author Montero Lobato in 1920 for the Fontoura Serpe e Cia firm to promote hygiene to children in the advertising for its products.
